subdivision_of_building: The proposal relates to a section of roof space within the factory unit as shown on plans
description: First floor extension to accommodate 22 working studio units (Use Class E(g)ii/E(g)iii/B2)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): Location Plan; D984-05-01 Rev A Existing & Proposed Floor Plans; D984-05-02 Rev A Existing & Proposed Elevations; D984-05-03 Rev A Existing & Proposed Sections; D984-05-04 Rev A Existing & Proposed Site Plan; D984-Plum-01 Rev 00 Drainage Layout; D984-05-3a Rev 00 Blow-Up Revised Proposed Section 2; Covering Letter prepared by Sunbeam Group dated 20 May 2022.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The external materials to be used in the development shall be as described on the plans and in the submitted application form.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surrounding, in accordance with policies P5 and D3 of the Old Oak and Park Royal Development Corporation Local Plan (2022), and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order, 1995 as amended, or any future amendments, the building shall be used only within Use Class E(g)ii, E(g)iii and B2 of the Town & Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 as amended, and for no other purpose, without the prior written permission of the local planning authority.

Reason: To safeguard the Business or industrial uses on the site in accordance with Policy E4, E5, E6 and E7 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy P5 of the Old Oak and Park Royal Development Corporation Local Plan (2022). | No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development, other than those listed in plans contained in Condition 2, shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies D3 and D5 of the Old Oak and Park Royal Development Corporation Local Plan (2022). | Notwithstanding the reports submitted with this planning application, prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
-	Details of construction hours;

-	Noise/Vibration mitigation measures. Information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009+A1:2014 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise, BS 5228-2:2009+A1:2014;
-	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
-	Site security during construction;
-	Construction methods;
-	Site management and access;
-	Vehicle and machinery specifications;
-	Numbers / frequency of vehicles/deliveries;
-	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies D14, SI1, T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies D5 and EU5 of the Old Oak and Park Royal Development Corporation Local Plan (2022). | Refuse and cycle storage shall be provided on site in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the occupation of the development and retained permanently.

Reason: To protect amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policy EU6 of the Old Oak and Park Royal Development Corporation Local Plan (2022) and London Plan (2021) policies SI7, SI8 and T5. | The sound insulation of the building envelope and of any mitigation measures shall ensure that noise from internal uses and activities is contained within the building, as assessed according to standards of the Council's SPG10 and criteria of BS8233:2014, at the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises incl. internal rooms and external amenity spaces. Measures shall be implemented prior to use of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies D3, D5 and EU5 of the Old Oak and Park Royal Development Corporation Local Plan (2022), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise, in accordance with policies D3, D5 and EU5 of the Old Oak and Park Royal Development Corporation Local Plan (2022), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | a) Prior to construction completion the development shall install the PV array as detailed in the proposed plans (drawing D984-05-04) submitted on 28 April 2022.

b) Upon final construction of the development the agreed PV monitoring meter shall be installed. The monitoring shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in the Automated Energy Monitoring Platform (AEMP) information document.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmentally sustainable development in accordance with policies SI1, SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan 2021, guidance note 11 of the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2018, policies EU4 and EU9 of the Old Oak and Park Royal Development Corporation (2022) and Policy 2.5.36 (Best Practice) of the Mayor's Sustainable Design & Construction SPG.
